intro: Pouchetia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered pouchetia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Pouchetia parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
